intro: Casearia marquetei, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bright blue berries that appear in late summer. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
